regulation_metadata.title: Recording and Reporting Occupational Injuries and Illnesses
legal_basis: Secretary of Labor's Orders No. 3-2000 (65 FR 50017)
Secretary of Labor's Orders No. 1-2012 (77 FR 3912)
regulation_metadata.purpose: to require employers to record and report work-related fatalities, injuries, and illnesses

editorial_notes.note: Congressional Review Act and Public Law 115-21 required removal of all amendments published at 81 FR 91792, Dec. 19, 2016

regulation_metadata.disclaimer: Recording or reporting a work-related injury, illness, or fatality does not mean that the employer or employee was at fault, that an OSHA rule has been violated, or that the employee is eligible for workers' compensation or other benefits.

size_exemptions.verbatim_text: If your company had 10 or fewer employees at all times during the last calendar year, you do not need to keep OSHA injury and illness records unless OSHA or the Bureau of Labor Statistics informs you in writing that you must keep records under § 1904.41 or § 1904.42.

industry_exemptions.verbatim_text: If your business establishment is classified in a specific industry group listed in appendix A to this subpart, you do not need to keep OSHA injury and illness records unless the government asks you to keep the records under § 1904.41 or § 1904.42.

view complete NAICS structure with codes and titles

multi_agency_compliance.requirement: OSHA accepts other agency records if they contain same information as part 1904 requires

decision_path.question: Did the employee experience an injury or illness?
decision_path.notes: Basic threshold - must be actual injury or illness

decision_path.question: Is the injury or illness work-related?
Is the injury or illness a new case?
Does the injury or illness meet the general recording criteria or the application to specific cases?

work_relatedness_criteria.basic_requirement: injury or illness is work-related if event or exposure in work environment caused, contributed to, or significantly aggravated the condition
work_relatedness_criteria.presumption: work-relatedness is presumed for injuries and illnesses in work environment unless exception applies
work_relatedness_criteria.work_environment_definition: establishment and other locations where employees work or are present as condition of employment, including equipment and materials

exceptions.description: employee present as member of general public rather than as employee
signs or symptoms surface at work but result solely from non-work-related event outside work environment
results solely from voluntary participation in wellness program, medical/fitness/recreational activity
solely result of eating, drinking, or preparing food for personal consumption
exceptions.note: exception does not apply if food contaminated by workplace contaminants or food poisoning from employer-supplied food

exceptions.description: solely result of personal tasks unrelated to employment outside assigned working hours
solely result of personal grooming, self medication for non-work condition, or intentionally self-inflicted
motor vehicle accident on company parking lot or access road while commuting

exceptions.note: contagious diseases like tuberculosis, brucellosis, hepatitis A, plague are work-related if infected at work

exceptions.description: mental illness unless employee voluntarily provides physician opinion stating work-relatedness

travel_status_rules.work_related_if: engaged in work activities in interest of employer
travel_status_rules.examples: travel to/from customer contacts, job tasks, work-related entertainment

hotel_rules.establishes_home_away_from_home: evaluate activities same as non-traveling employee
hotel_rules.commuting_exception: injuries while commuting between temporary residence and job location not work-related

travel_status_rules.personal_detour_exception: injuries during personal detour from reasonably direct route not work-related

work_at_home_rules.work_related_if: injury occurs while performing work for pay and directly related to work performance
examples_work_related: needle puncture from work sewing machine
examples_not_work_related: tripping on family dog while answering work call

new_case_determination.chronic_illness_rule: occupational illnesses with recurring symptoms recorded only once
new_case_determination.episodic_illness_rule: each episode caused by workplace event treated as new case
new_case_determination.physician_consultation: may rely on physician recommendation about new case vs recurrence
